comments:
In the Variables view in the debug perspective, if you want to use the "change 
variable value" option to modify a String, but you are working from the 
expanded "value" section:

ex. If the string name is thisString and the value is "word", you see

thisString= "word"
   count=4
   hash=1
   offset=0
   value=char[4]
      [0]=w
      [1]=o
      [2]=r
      [3]=d

You want to change the value to "wor", so you right-click on [3]=d and select
"Change Variable Value"

You press backspace to delete the d and press enter.

Eclipse will not accept this value. The text box in which you're supposed to 
edit the variable does not disappear. You cannot change any other variables 
inside the Variables view. If you try to scroll up or down, [3]=<text box> will 
stay in the same spot as you scroll up and down 

ie. if you scroll up, it "moves" up so it can stay in the same space on the 
screen, ex. if you move one line up, you will see:

thisString= "word"
   count=4
   hash=1
   offset=0
   value=char[4]
      [0]=w
      [1]=o
      [3]=<text box>
      [3]=d

If you move two lines up you will see

thisString= "word"
   count=4
   hash=1
   offset=0
   value=char[4]
      [0]=w
      [3]=<text box>
      [2]=r
      [3]=d

There are exceptions reported in the command console and in the log:

We no longer use an inline text editor for changing variable values. The bug 
as reported is no longer valid.
